snippet: An appellate court ruling goes the wrong way on whether employer health plans must cover birth control.
abstract: Editorial criticizes appeals court ruling finding Affordable Care Act's mandate that employer health plans cover birth control 'trammels the right of free exercise' under the Religious Freedom Restoration Act; urges Supreme Court to take up  issue and resolve conflicting opinions in case by firmly rejecting the dangerous view that private employers can use their religious belief to discriminate against women.
lead_paragraph: An appellate court ruling goes the wrong way on whether employer health plans must cover birth control.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
